documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's all for friday 's live coverage , but we 'll be back from 08:00 on monday with more news , sport , travel and weather from across the region .
in the meantime this page will be updated automatically with material from across the bbc .
thanks for joining us , and have a great weekend .

documents.title: weather : turning drier
text: the odd shower may continue overnight , but most will be dry with lengthy clear spells allowing it to turn chilly , especially in rural parts .
thicker cloud will arrive in the south towards dawn , perhaps with a few showers .
more at bbc weather .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: chihuahua puppy stolen at knifepoint
text: a chihuahua puppy has been stolen at knife point from its owner who has chased the thief in manchester .
four-month-old dalai was sitting next to his owner outside his home in addison close , ardwick on thursday july 27 when a man grabbed him just after 23:00 bst .
police said he gave chase but was then threatened with a knife by the thief 's accomplice .
det con tom munnery of greater manchester police said : dalai 's family have been left devastated by this and want nothing more than him returned safely. ``

documents.title: mata to donate 1 % of wage to charity
text: mata to donate 1 % of wage to charity

documents.title: food 11 months past use-by-date for sale in manchester shop
text: a manchester convenience store has been fined more than £ 9,500 after food items were discovered on sale that were nearly a year past their use-by date .

during a visit to kashmir mart in cheetham hill on 14 june 2016 council officers found a pack of sliced chicken tikka with a use-by date of 29 august 2015 , six packets of sliced chicken breast with a use-by date of 17 november 2015 and 12 packs of mortadella with a use by-date of 3 june 2016 .
awaan enterprises ( uk ) ltd , who operate kashmir mart , pleaded guilty to having food on sale past its use-by date at manchester magistrates ' court .
the company was fined £ 8,000 and ordered to pay cost of £ 1,673 .

the negligence of this company put the public at risk , if sold and unwittingly eaten these items could have made someone seriously ill and it is only luck and the diligence of our officers that prevented the worst-case scenario from unfolding .

documents.title: lallana out for 'couple of months '
text: lallana out for 'couple of months '

documents.title: latest headlines for the north west
text: latest headlines for the north west

documents.title: amir khan and wife faryal 'to split ' according to their very public twitter spat
text: amir khan has announced on social media that he and his wife faryal are `` to split '' .
he also seemingly accuses her of cheating on him with fellow boxer anthony joshua .
his wife has responded accusing amir khan of cheating : `` i think he just needs some attention because boxing has n't been going well . ''
anthony joshua has denied any relationship , saying he has `` never even met '' faryal makhdoom khan .

documents.title: lancs rename pavilion end after anderson
text: lancs rename pavilion end after anderson

documents.title: two boys , 13 , arrested over violent disorder
text: two 13-year-old boys have been arrested as part of a clampdown on anti-social behaviour in liverpool .
the youngsters were held alongside two 15-year-old boys after an alleged assault in mill street , toxteth at 21:45 bst on sunday , merseyside police said .
they are due to be questioned later .
ch insp matt boyle said : `` we are taking appropriate action alongside partner agencies to prevent violence and disorder in the l8 area and deal with any offenders . ''

documents.title: call for fox hunt law change after ruling
text: campaigners are calling for a change in the law after a decision not to charge anyone involved in a hunt that spilled on to a residential street .
police probed reports hounds filled a street in macclesfield , cheshire , in february and allegedly killed a fox .
lesley martin from cheshire monitors said `` the law needs to be strengthened '' and loopholes must be tightened .
the cps said there was not enough evidence to prove the animal 's death was caused deliberately .

documents.title: blackpool illuminations get £ 100,000 boost
text: blackpool illuminations will be even brighter this year after getting a £ 100,000 sponsorship boost .
author: Blackpool Gazette

documents.title: solihull v chester is postponed
text: solihull v chester is postponed

documents.title: latest headlines for the north west
text: latest headlines for the north west

documents.title: it glitch delayed degree results released
text: students at a lancashire college whose degree results were delayed by it issues have finally got their grades four weeks later than scheduled .
an anomaly with the data led lancaster university to query the results from blackburn college where a new it system was operating .
the results should have been due on 7 july but could not be released until lancaster university , which was the validating body , was happy data it received from the college was accurate .
a blackburn college spokeswoman said : `` students are receiving their results today . ''

documents.title: man carrying axe pours petrol on shop worker
text: a man carrying an axe poured petrol over a staff member during an attempted robbery at asda in leigh , police said .
he threatened to set the worker on fire in the store on windermere road at about 22.45 last friday .
the offender ( who was about 5ft 8ins and slim , was chased out of the shop and ran towards leigh road .
police are appealing for information .

fortunately [ the staff member , who showed incredible bravery , ] was n't injured but nobody should have to come into work and be put through such a traumatic experience when they are just trying to do their job .

documents.title: fracking firm 'getting away with ' breach
text: a shale gas firm has been accused of `` getting away with whatever they want to do '' by anti-fracking protesters after breaching planning rules .
last month cuadrilla took delivery of a drilling rig at its little plumpton site outside permitted working hours .
lancashire county council denied letting the firm off but did not demand the removal of the rig .
campaigners have accused cuadrilla of `` riding roughshod '' over planning enforcement policy .

documents.title: watchdog probes police response to siege
text: the way officers responded to a disturbance that led to a 26-hour siege in greater manchester is being investigated by the police watchdog .
police were sent to a house in shaw , oldham , in the early hours of 25 july amid concerns for a woman 's welfare .
they later returned at 03:15 to reports of a man allegedly armed with a gun , holding a woman and two children hostage .
the independent police complaints commission is now investigating .

documents.title: barnsley sign potts from blackpool
text: barnsley sign potts from blackpool

documents.title: weather : dry and sunny
text: showers will tend to die away through the afternoon , leaving a largely dry and sunny end to the day .
a mostly dry night will follow , with some clear spells .
however , southern parts may see thickening cloud spread in from the south towards dawn .
more from bbc weather .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: parent killer deaths 'predictable ' , report says
text: the deaths of a husband and wife who were killed by their schizophrenic son were `` predictable but not preventable '' , an independent review has found .
timothy brown , 47 , was receiving help from mersey care when he stabbed his parents to death in 2014 .
brown , of devonshire road , toxteth , claimed a `` spaceman '' told him to kill his parents paul , 73 , and dorothy , 66 .
the review of his care and treatment found `` fundamental errors '' in his `` structured risk management '' .
niche patient safety , who carried out the investigation for nhs england , also found brown had previously stabbed his grandmother 's dog to death .
referred to as 's ' in the review , brown admitted manslaughter but denied murder and was detained at a secure mental hospital following a trial in march 2015 .
it is our view that the homicide of s 's parents was certainly predictable but was not preventable .

documents.title: accrington sign danish keeper jorgensen
text: accrington sign danish keeper jorgensen

documents.title: wolf-whistling parrot ruffles feathers
text: a tesco store in greater manchester received complaints after customers received unwelcome attention .
builders were accused of wolf-whistling at shoppers but when they protested their innocence , the real culprit was unmasked as a local character called ted .

documents.title: latest headlines for the north west
text: latest headlines for the north west

documents.title: liverpool , celtic & everton learn draws
text: liverpool , celtic & everton learn draws

documents.title: england is his ( and it owes him a living )
text: the unauthorised morrissey biopic england is mine is out in uk cinemas today - you can read what its director and star had to say about it .
morrissey has n't had anything to do with the film ( apart from , you know , living his life ) so moz-watchers are waiting to see what he thinks of it .
one clue might be the fact he 's just put england is mine t-shirts on his official online store .
the title comes from the smiths song still ill - `` england is mine , it owes me a living . ''
coincidence ?
is this a tacit endorsement ?
does he figure that if anyone 's going to cash in , it should be him ?
there 's no rant about the film on his facebook page yet - but the weekend is young .
given his fierce protection of animal rights , there is an alternative version of the t-shirt with of farmyard animals and the words `` england is theirs and we owe them a living '' .
author: Ian Youngs
Entertainment and Arts Reporter, BBC News

documents.title: drugs worth £ 66m seized in hull : six charged
text: six men , including three from manchester , liverpool , and southport , have been charged over a haul of drugs with an estimated street value of more than £ 66m .
uk border force officers stopped a lorry at the king george dock , hull , on 17 may as part of an ongoing operation by greater manchester police 's serious and organised crime group .
when the lorry was searched officers found about 58kg of cocaine and almost 84kg of heroin inside .
police have charged six men with conspiracy to fraudulently evade duty , prohibition or provision and conspiracy to supply a class a drug .
the men are due to appear at manchester crown court on 31 august .

documents.title: rossendale house fire : woman named as leanne collopy
text: a woman who died after being found with stab wounds following a house fire has been named .
leanne collopy , 25 , was pulled out of a house fire on burnley road , rossendale , on sunday night along with a baby girl and a 39-year-old man .
they were all taken to hospital , where the woman was found to have a number of stab wounds .
she died on thursday .
a 39-year-old man was arrested on sus of attempted murder and remains in hospital for treatment .
the 23-month-old girl is also receiving treatment .
police said they both suffered `` a number of serious injuries '' .

documents.title: blackburn sign chapman on season 's loan
text: blackburn sign chapman on season 's loan

documents.title: latest headlines for the north west
text: latest headlines for the north west

documents.title: funding plan for key motorway link
text: highways chiefs are considering a £ 1.7m contribution to a new road which would ease traffic congestion between blackpool and st annes .
author: Blackpool Gazette

documents.title: man arrested after house fire stab death
text: a man has been arrested on sus of attempted murder after a 25-year-old woman died following a house fire .
firefighters rescued a man , a woman and a baby girl during the blaze at a property in burnley road , rossendale , on sunday .
the woman who had suffered stab wounds died in hospital yesterday .
a 39-year-old man remains in custody .

documents.title: man released in 2003 missing girl probe
text: a man arrested on sus of murdering a blackpool teenager who has been missing for nearly 14 years has been released .
charlene downes , 14 , was last seen on 1 november 2003 .
her body has never been found .
a 51-year-old man from preston , who was arrested on tuesday , has been released while inquiries continue , police said .
a £ 100,000 reward remains on offer for information leading to a conviction .

text: sunny spells with outbreaks of showers are likely throughout the day .
some of the showers will be heavy , but will tend to die away through the afternoon .
this will allow a largely dry and sunny end to the day .
highs of 18c .

until then , this page will be updated automatically with content from across the bbc .
have a good evening .

documents.title: weather : a cool breezy night in store
text: it will be mostly cloudy with showers around coastal areas and hills overnight .
however , there will be some clear spells developing inland .
it will be a breezy night , especially around the coast , and feeling cool .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: firefighters rescue kitten from a tree
text: fire crews in wilmslow and macclesfield have helped a kitten in distress .
firefighters from wilmslow and macclesfield were called by @ twitterid to rescue a kitten that was stuck up a tree in wilmslow .
good job guys
thanks for your kind words , tracey : )
well done you guys !
our hero 's for man and beast lovely story
well done !
thank you for supporting the # rspca
kitties everywhere are very thankful for your help and sorry you probably had to put up with quite a few smart remarks .
yay thank you guys xxx

documents.title: hmp kirkham prisoner found in liverpool
text: a prisoner who absconded from hmp kirkham has been found , police said .
paul trundle , 30 , from huyton , liverpool , who was jailed for 30 months for robbery went missing on tuesday .
police said he was arrested in liverpool on wednesday .

documents.title: breakingman held over 2003 missing girl probe is released
text: a man arrested on sus of murdering a blackpool teenager who has been missing for nearly 14 years has been released .
charlene downes , 14 , was last seen on 1 november 2003 .
her body has never been found .
lancashire police said the 51-year-old man has been released while inquiries continue .

documents.title: artist impression of plans for 200 homes on former camelot theme park site
text: an artist 's impression of the scaled-back development on the former camelot theme park site in chorley has been released by developers .
story homes has submitted plans to chorley council to build almost 200 homes .
the tourist attraction closed in 2012 and planning director david o'reilly said the site was `` in desperate need of regeneration '' .
`` we want to replace this eyesore with a high quality scheme that local residents and businesses will be proud of . ''

documents.title: man jailed for stabbing his partner and her mother
text: a man tried to kill his partner and her mother after taking a `` lethal cocktail '' of alcohol and cocaine following a birthday night out , a court was told .
simon cragg lured janet platt , 53 , downstairs at his house in woolston , warrington then repeatedly stabbed her .
he then knifed his girlfriend natalie platt , 29 , when she heard her mother 's screams and went to investigate .
mechanic cragg , 31 , who admitted two counts of attempted murder , was jailed for 16 years at liverpool crown court .

documents.title: woman held on sus of murder over fatal stabbing
text: a 22-year-old woman has been arrested on sus of murdering a man in preston .
the 26-year-old victim was found stabbed in the stomach at a house on geoffrey street shortly after midnight .
he was taken to hospital but later died , lancashire police said .

documents.title: latest headlines from the north west
text: latest headlines from the north west

documents.title: appeal after man fired at with stun gun
text: a man has been targeted with a stun gun and punched repeatedly , police said .
the 21-year-old victim was walking to his van on frank street in bury , greater manchester at about 18:30 on 22 july when he noticed a blue ford focus on edward street with three people inside .
two of the occupants got out of the car before stunning him and stealing his money .
he ran to bury market to get help .
this was a horrific attack during daylight hours which left the victim extremely shaken and in a lot pain .
we believe that the ford focus was using false registration plates of ml15 ytx .

documents.title: fourth night of dispersal zone in liverpool 8
text: a dispersal zone has been put in place to `` tackle anti-social behaviour and disorder '' , merseyside police said .
if a person has been directed to leave the area and returns during the period of the dispersal notice an offence will have been committed , police added .

documents.title: blow to plans for former burnley theatre
text: plans to save burnley 's empire theatre have taken a huge blow after a study showed the grade ii-listed building would cost more than £ 5m to be brought back to life .
author: Lancashire Telegraph

documents.title: murder charge after man stabbed in oldham flat
text: a man has been charged with murder after a fatal stabbing at a flat .
jonathan herd , 44 , was found with multiple stab wounds at the home in lees new road , oldham , on sunday and died at the scene .
michael pickering , 30 , of no fixed address , appeared before magistrates in ashton under-lyne and was remanded to appear at manchester crown court on friday .
two other men remain in custody in connection with the investigation .

documents.title: latest headlines from the north west
text: latest headlines from the north west

documents.title: mike grimshaw death : second arrest over street stabbing death
text: a second man has been arrested on sus of murdering a man who died after intervening in a street row .
mike grimshaw , 34 , was stabbed in the neck during the disturbance in royton avenue , sale , greater manchester , on 20 july .
he was given first aid before being taken to hospital , where he later died .
a 31-year-old man is being questioned .
a 16-year-old boy also arrested on sus of murder was released while inquiries continue .

documents.title: doncaster sign ben khemis and kongolo
text: doncaster sign ben khemis and kongolo

documents.title: woman visits seaside resort for 84 years
text: some may find it hard to their summer holiday destination - but not for a woman who has returned to the same seaside town for 84 years .
barbara johnson has visited lytham in lancashire since 1933 , most recently making the 70 mile trip from her home in macclesfield , cheshire .
although she has visited france and switzerland in the intervening years , the resort remains her first choice .
i might not be here next year , but if i am , i 'm going to lytham . ''

documents.title: uk universities need urgent brexit 'clarity ' from ministers
text: uk universities could lose talented eu staff unless they receive `` greater clarity '' from the government on the post-brexit rights of eu nationals , according to the russell group .

the group of top research universities , which includes manchester university and liverpool university , says brexit is causing eu staff `` uncertainty and anxiety '' and making the recruitment of others harder .
the group has outlined 10 points it says the government must answer .
ministers say they want `` a reciprocal agreement as quickly as possible '' .

documents.title: weather : windy with showers
text: you will still need your umbrella with intermittent showers through the afternoon and evening .
it will continue to be be blustery with highs of 19c .

documents.title: man 's ear bitten off in radcliffe
text: police have released an image of a man who they want to speak to after another man 's ear was bitten off .
the victim , who is in his 40s , was at the overdraught pub in radcliffe , greater manchester , on 1 july when he was punched by a man .
the offender then bit his ear off before leaving the pub .
the victim has since required plastic surgery .
i would also urge anyone who was in or around the pub at the time of the attack to come forward .

documents.title: filming generates £ 8m investment for liverpool economy
text: the shooting of tv , films and adverts in liverpool has generated £ 8.4m for the local economy in the past year , a report by the city 's film office has revealed .
recent productions include upcoming movie film stars do n't die in liverpool with annette bening and jamie bell , and tv dramas peaky blinders , little boy blue and witness for the prosecution .
the report shows that 317 productions were filmed in liverpool in 2016/17 , generating about £ 103,000 ( excluding vat ) in direct income to liverpool city council for services and location fees .

documents.title: football : nemanja matic starts as man utd beat sampdoria
text: nemanja matic made his first appearance for manchester united as they completed their pre-season friendlies with a 2-1 win over sampdoria in dublin .
the 29-year-old , who arrived from chelsea last week for £ 40m , played the first 45 minutes at the aviva stadium .
henrikh mkhitaryan headed home an early opener for united , before dennis praet levelled the score midway through the second half .
juan mata netted the winner when he swept in anthony martial 's cross .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: work to start on accrington revamp
text: work will begin on a revamp of accrington 's historic town square later this month .
the new space will commemorate the accrington pals batallion and will be at the centre of the restoration of some of the lancashire town 's key buildings .
construction work is also expected to start in early 2018 on the blackburn road area .

i 'm looking forward to seeing the works progress on site as a new phase of history unfolds , with the creation of a new town square and public realm scheme outside accrington town hall and market hall to commemorate the accrington pals .

documents.title: disgraced breast surgeon has sentence increased
text: disgraced surgeon , ian paterson , who was jailed over needless breast operations , has had his sentence increased from 15 to 20 years .

ian paterson , 59 , from altrincham , who appeared at the court of appeal via video link , was told his current sentence was `` not sufficient '' to reflect the seriousness and the totality of his offending .
paterson was found guilty in may at nottingham crown court of 17 counts of wounding with intent .
jurors also convicted him of three further wounding charges .

documents.title: family appeal after father missing for a year
text: the children of a bolton man who has been missing for a year say they miss their father and want him to come home .
james hodgkiss , 35 , who has three children , was last seen wheeling a suitcase towards the town centre on 3 august 2016 .
his family are asking anyone with information to get in touch .
this is out of character for james and we are appealing for him to get in touch so we know he is okay .
he has links to the crown lane area of horwich , blackrod and little hulton .
if you recognise james and have seen him , please contact police .

documents.title: forest sign everton 's dowell on loan
text: forest sign everton 's dowell on loan

documents.title: latest headlines from the north west
text: latest headlines from the north west

documents.title: campaign to save one of region 's oldest cinemas
text: an online campaign has been launched to buy a lancashire cinema .
the palace cinema in longridge has been put up for sale by its 81-year-old owner .
one of the oldest surviving cinemas in northwest england , the building was constructed in the 1860s as a weaving shed .
it has also been used as a music hall , roller skating rink and bingo hall .

documents.title: chester zoo named second most popular paid uk attraction
text: chester zoo is the uk 's most popular paid attraction outside london , a report by visit england has revealed .
with 1.9m visitors in 2016 , it was only beaten by the tower of london , which drew 2.7m tourists .
in terms of free attractions , merseyside maritime museum and the museum of liverpool were in the top 20 with more than 800,000 visitors each .

documents.title: man charged after £ 500,000 drugs find
text: a man is due in court later after £ 500,000 worth of drugs were found at a house in merseyside .
officers discovered heroin , cocaine and cannabis during a search of the property in gorsey lane , wallasey , merseyside police said .
michael wilson , 38 , was charged with possession with intent to supply heroin and cocaine ; possession of a class b drug ; acquiring criminal property and production of cannabis .
he is due to appear at wirral magistrates ' court .

documents.title: young manchester city fan trains with sergio aguero
text: a young manchester city fanatic , who had bone cancer and now attends amputee football sessions , was given a day to remember after being invited to train with his heroes .
author: Manchester Evening News

documents.title: more libraries could reopen in lancashire
text: proposals to reopen a further two libraries in lancashire are to be considered by the county council 's cabinet .
twenty-six of the council 's 73 libraries were shut last year by its previous cabinet as part of plans to save £ 65m .
in july , the cabinet agreed plans for the phased reopening of 14 libraries , nine of which will be run by the county council and five as independent community libraries .
it has been proposed that parbold library and thornton library should now be added to those that will reopen between november and april .

we are grateful to all the voluntary and community groups who have and continue to commit time and resources into the library service and its future development we want to improve people 's access to libraries as soon as we can '' .

documents.title: morrissey movie director : 'we do n't want to upset him '
text: as subjects for music bio go , there can be few trickier than morrissey , the idolised , enigmatic , prickly former frontman of the smiths .
however , that reputation did not deter an oscar-nominated film-maker who grew up near the singer in stretford .
like countless other 1980s music fans , mark gill was `` obsessed '' with the smiths .
so he was desperate to be the one to tell morrissey 's story .
mark gill said :
i wanted to make this film and i was determined that if anyone was going to cock it up , it would be me .
author: Ian Youngs
Entertainment and Arts Reporter, BBC News

documents.title: fresh appeal over liverpool mum 's killing
text: detectives investigating the murder of a mother of three in liverpool are appealing for information on the 12th anniversary of her death .
lucy hargreaves , 22 , was shot as she slept on the sofa of her home in walton in august 2005 .
her partner and two-year-old daughter were upstairs .
the house was then set on fire .
officers say they are keen to want to speak to 37-year-old kevin parle who is believed to be abroad .

documents.title: football : everton captain signs one-year contract extension
text: everton captain phil jagielka has signed a one-year contract extension to keep him at the club until 2019 .
the 34-year-old defender played 27 times as the toffees finished seventh in the premier league last season .
everton have made seven new signings this summer and jagielka now wants to help create `` special memories '' .
the club is moving forward .
i do not think the transfer business is finished but it is good we have got people in nice and early .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: retired boxer calls for more dementia research
text: a retired manchester boxer who 's fighting a rare form of dementia is calling for sporting bodies to invest money into researching the disease .
peter flanagan , who is 60 , was diagnosed earlier this year with dementia pugilistica .
he says medics believe it was caused by repeated blows to the head during his six-year career in the ring .
peter 's daughter tina says it 's time the sporting bodies took some responsibility , adding : `` we need officials to get on board and help us . ''
the british boxing board of control said it recognises there is a problem and remains willing to join in research particularly in areas that concerns the brain .

documents.title: football : liverpool lose on penalties in audi cup final
text: liverpool suffered their first defeat of the pre-season campaign after losing 5-4 on penalties in the audi cup final against atletico madrid in munich .
the game finished 1-1 after 90 minutes , with roberto firmino 's spot-kick cancelling out keidi bare 's first-half opener for the la liga side .
liverpool captain jordan henderson saw his penalty saved by miguel angel moya in the resulting shootout .
and filipe luis stepped up to net the decisive spot-kick .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: mental health patients stranded in units for years
text: a 59-year-old mental health patient spent 602 days awaiting discharge from an acute unit at the pennine care nhs foundation trust , figures have revealed .
in the past two years , at least 91 patients in the uk have waited more than a year to be discharged , with at least seven patients waiting more than two years .
at least 320 patients had to wait at least 100 days to be discharged , bbc freedom of information requests show .
experts say a lack of suitable accommodation and wrangling over budgets are to blame for the delays .

documents.title: weather : showers with spells of sunshine
text: showers will move through the region quite quickly but they will become lighter .
some spells of sunshine will break through .
highs of 20c .
more from bbc weather

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's it from us until 08:00 on thursday , when we 'll be back with more news , sport , travel and weather updates from across the region .
until then , our colleagues will publish updates automatically on this page .
have a great evening .

documents.title: weather : blustery showers overnight
text: rain will clear , allowing it to turn drier and clearer for a time .
overnight though will see a scattering of blustery showers move in , with the showers turning heavy at times , especially in the early hours of thursday morning .
more from bbc weather
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: cctv of moped riders risking their lives by speeding through a level crossing
text: footage of the shocking moment two youngsters on a moped risk their lives by speeding through a closing level crossing in altrincham .
author: Manchester Evening News

documents.title: blackpool tops list for drug-related deaths for sixth successive year
text: blackpool has recorded the highest rate of drug-related deaths in england and wales for the sixth consecutive year according to the office for national statistics ( ons ) .
the figures show there are roughly 20 deaths for every 100,000 people - almost five times the average figure for england .
the ons said port talbot , neath in wales has the second highest with an average of 11.6 deaths for 100,000 people followed by burnley with 11.3 .

documents.title: salford to be without flanagan and tasi
text: salford to be without flanagan and tasi

documents.title: star line-up for lytham festival
text: the lytham festival opens later with a number of headline acts , including olly murs , madness and hacienda classical .
the five-day event begins tonight with murs and the mersey beatles .
the hacienda and manchester camerata , the city 's experimental orchestra , will collaborate tomorrow with the dj 's who shaped the hacienda 's sound .
the human league , madness and the west end proms are given top billing over the weekend .

documents.title: mother 's plea over ex-soldier 's terror charge in turkey
text: the mother of a former british soldier describes her son joe robinson 's arrest on a terrorism charge while on holiday in turkey as `` the most ridiculous thing i have ever heard in my life '' .
sharon robinson spoke out after her son joe robinson , 24 , who lives in leeds , was arrested in the coastal town of didim .
he is thought to be under sus of sharing material on social media from his time in syria with kurdish militia .
lawyer kaya kayaoglu said : `` we do not know when he will be taken to court . ''
plea from mum of joe robinson , the ex-soldier from accrington arrested as `` terrorist '' in turkey after fighting with kurds against isis .
both sides isis and ppk kurd party are terrorist
joe robinson should not be imprisoned in aydin , turkey .
he is no more a terrorist than i am .
free him now turkish authorities .
if i could help fight against daesh , i would .
author: BBC North West Tonight

documents.title: latest headlines for the north west
text: latest headlines for the north west

documents.title: damning cctv footage which helped convict mark hillman 's killers
text: the damning cctv footage helped lock up three gangland thugs after the gun murder of mark hillman .
author: Liverpool Echo

documents.title: stranded pup named after former one direction star
text: a seal pup found stranded on rocks has been named after former one direction and dunkirk star harry styles .
the animal was rescued by the rspca after he was spotted on rocks at west kirby marine park in wirral , merseyside , last week .
the pup , who was struggling to breathe , was taken to a wildlife centre where he is receiving treatment and has been named after styles , whose character in dunkirk is rescued from drowning .

documents.title: weather : turning drier
text: rain will clear , allowing it to turn drier and clearer for a time .
more from bbc weather
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: 'exploding zombie ' bug attacks lancashire caterpillars
text: caterpillars are being killed by a bug which turns them into `` exploding zombies '' , a wildlife expert has said .
lancashire , manchester and north merseyside wildlife trust said the skins of insects have been found on winmarleigh moss , near garstang .
the baculovirus drives caterpillars on a `` death march '' to the top of plants , then when it dies the bug bursts out to seek other victims .
the trust 's dr chris miller said it was `` gruesome - like a zombie horror film '' .

documents.title: man , 90 , charged over fatal hospital crash
text: a 90-year-old man has been charged with causing death by dangerous driving after two women were hit by a car in a hospital car park .
clare haslam and deborah clifton , from chorlton , manchester were hit by a ford focus outside the city 's withington hospital on 7 march .
the couple were both taken to hospital where they later died .
philip bull , of button lane , manchester has been bailed to appear before magistrates on 31 august .
ms haslam , 44 , and 49-year-old ms clifton had a child and were `` blissfully happy soulmates '' , their families said .

documents.title: listed status for jodrell bank telescope
text: jodrell bank 's second largest radio telescope has been given grade i listed status for its pioneering role in radio astronomy .
the radio telescope is the smaller of the two large dishes at the observatory site .
the lovell telescope , the other dish , was given the same status in 1988 .
historic england said the listing will celebrate the cheshire observatory 's history and its impact on the world .

documents.title: latest headlines for the north west
text: latest headlines for the north west

documents.title: fines plan to end gull attack danger
text: a fylde coast authority could be set to declare war on seagulls - anyone caught feeding them facing a £ 100 fine under legislation designed to tackle anti-social behaviour .
author: Blackpool Gazette

documents.title: mail online 'sorry ' over terror attack photo error
text: a national newspaper website has apologised for publishing a photo of a girl murdered in 2013 among of people reported missing following the manchester arena .
the mail online published a `` viral '' social media post of jayden parkinson the day after 22 people were killed when salman abedi detonated the bomb at an ariana grande concert on 22 may .
jayden , 17 , was strangled by her ex-boyfriend and her body found buried in a graveyard in didcot , oxfordshire , in december 2013 .
in a letter to her mother samantha shrewsbury , ashlee gagui , editorial manager at mail online , apologised for causing her family `` further grief '' .

documents.title: former deputy school head teacher denies sex offences
text: a former deputy head teacher has denied sexual offences against pupils .
grahame brennand , 69 , of calder avenue , preston , pleaded not guilty to 24 counts of indecent assault against girls at st john 's primary school in baxenden , lancashire in the 1970s and 1980s .
he was bailed and is due to go on trial at preston crown court on 2 january .

documents.title: weather : windy with outbreaks of rain this afternoon
text: winds will strengthen this afternoon , along with some outbreaks of rain .
highs of 20c are expected .
blustery showers tonight , some of them heavy .
more from bbc weather .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: five charged with misconduct in alleged football matches betting probe
text: five people have been charged with misconduct following an investigation by the fa into alleged betting on football matches by several current and former players , afc fylde have confirmed .
the national league club said in a statement none of the five are charged with placing bets on afc fylde games .
internal disciplinary procedures have begun , the club added .
author: BBC Lancashire Sport

documents.title: drug dealer jailed for murdering rival in everton
text: a man has been jailed for life for murdering a 26-year-old man who was killed in a shooting .
mark hillman ( above ) had been lured to a house to sell drugs and was shot twice in the back as he got out of his car in everton last year , police said .
john paul johns , 22 , of broad lane , kirkby , was found guilty of murder on tuesday following a trial at liverpool crown court .
he was told he must serve a minimum of 25 years .

documents.title: misunderstanding ? wigan beat chorley 14-0
text: misunderstanding ? wigan beat chorley 14-0

documents.title: latest headlines for the north west
text: latest headlines for the north west

documents.title: blackburn sign canada keeper leutwiler
text: blackburn sign canada keeper leutwiler

documents.title: man charged with death by dangerous driving over hospital crash
text: a 90-year-old man has been charged with causing death by dangerous driving after two women died in a crash outside a hospital in manchester .
claire haslam , 44 , and 49-year-old deborah clifton were hit by a car outside withington community hospital on 7 march .
the couple , both of thorneycroft avenue , chorlton , died in hospital .
philip bull , of button lane , manchester , has been released on bail to appear before manchester and salford magistrates ' court on 31 august .

documents.title: football : england goalkeeper broke leg in 'whack ' with team-mate
text: england goalkeeper karen bardsley 's tournament-ending broken leg at women 's euro 2017 was caused by a collision with team-mate steph houghton , boss mark sampson has said .
manchester city 's bardsley , 32 , played on for over 10 minutes during sunday 's quarter-final win over france .
`` it was a hell of a bump .
steph gave her a whack by mistake , '' said sampson .
liverpool 's siobhan chamberlain , 33 , will replace bardsley against the netherlands in thursday 's semi-final .

documents.title: latest headlines for the north west
text: latest headlines for the north west

documents.title: school blaze treated as suspected arson
text: a fire that broke out in a disused building of a school is being treated as a suspected arson .
the `` serious '' blaze at st saviour 's catholic primary school in great sutton , ellesmere port , was reported at about 17:20 yesterday .
properties near seacombe drive were evacuated affecting about 20 residents .
a joint investigation between the police and cheshire fire and rescue service is under way .

documents.title: football : sturridge injured during liverpool pre-season win
text: daniel sturridge went off with a thigh injury after scoring in liverpool 's 3-0 win over bayern munich in the audi cup .
the england striker , 27 , scored 15 minutes after coming off the bench by chipping in the reds ' third goal .
but he immediately pulled up and was substituted on 87 minutes , with boss jurgen klopp saying he hoped `` it 's nothing serious '' .
sadio mane and mohamed salah also scored as liverpool set up a final against atletico madrid on wednesday .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: long delays and lane closed on m6 after crash
text: 1 lane remains closed on the # m6 s/b btwn j28+j27 nr # chorley while car involved in collision is recovered .
long delays on approach
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: air quality data 'falsified ' by council
text: hundreds of planning applications are to be reviewed after a council admitted its air pollution data was `` falsified '' to make it look cleaner .
cheshire east council said `` deliberate and systematic manipulation '' took place from 2012 to 2014 .
cheshire police is investigating whether any crimes were committed .
the council has apologised and said the falsified figures had caused `` serious problems '' in assessing applications for new developments .

documents.title: man to be sentenced for liverpool shooting murder
text: a man is due to be sentenced later after being found guilty of murdering a 26-year-old man who was killed in a shooting in liverpool .
mark hillman was shot twice in the back and found on a pavement in lloyd close , everton , on 27 april last year .
he died later in hospital .
john paul johns , 22 , of broad lane , kirkby , was found guilty of murder at liverpool crown court and is due to be sentenced at the same court later .
in february a man was jailed for murder and another for wounding with intent .

documents.title: security boss put 'pipe bomb in pocket '
text: an airport security manager `` popped a pipe bomb in her pocket '' for safekeeping when security staff found it in a passenger 's hand luggage , a trial has heard .
the `` crude improvised explosive device '' was found in nadeem muhammad 's carry-on luggage as he went through security at manchester airport on 30 january .
made from batteries , wire , masking tape and a marker pen tube it was `` potentially viable '' , the manchester crown court heard .
mr muhammad , 43 , denies possessing explosives with intent and his trial is due to resume later .

documents.title: headlines from the north west
text: headlines from the north west

documents.title: weather : cloudy morning with outbreaks of rain
text: skies will quickly cloud over this morning with outbreaks of rain .
winds will strengthen into the afternoon and there will be some drier spells at times , but it will stay cloudy .
highs of 20c .
more from bbc weather .

we 're here until 18:00 with all the latest news , sport , travel and weather from across the region .

documents.title: man guilty of murder over fatal shooting
text: man guilty of murder over fatal shooting

documents.title: weather : dry night ahead
text: showers will fade away this evening leaving a largely dry night .
lows of 11c .
outbreaks of rain and strong winds will spread across the region on wednesday with some heavy bursts in places and strong winds .
more from bbc weather
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: lightening strikes delay rail services
text: trains between manchester victoria and leeds and blackpool north and bradford are running at reduced speed causing delays as equipment has been damaged by lightning , northern has said .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: boy , 17 , charged over cigarette punch death
text: a 17-year-old boy has been charged with manslaughter following the death of a man who was punched when he was asked for a cigarette .
len saunders , 65 , was with a friend when they were asked whether they had a cigarette in st helens on 21 july .
mr saunders was punched in the head and fell .
he died two days later .
the 17-year-old is due to appear before liverpool youth court tomorrow .
a 15-year-old boy has been released without charge .

documents.title: homes evacuated after car breaks gas main
text: several homes were temporarily evacuated after gas mains equipment was struck by a car in birkenhead .
the car had driven in to monitoring equipment on neville close at about 5:30 , fracturing a gas main .
two men inside the car were taken to hospital for checks .
both carriageways of the m53 between junctions 2 and 3 were closed as a precaution .
firefighters remained at the scene for about two-and-a-half hours .

documents.title: latest headlines from the north west
text: latest headlines from the north west

documents.title: morecambe sign young defender lavelle
text: morecambe sign young defender lavelle

documents.title: pc goes behind bars to raise cash for mental health charity
text: a police officer is spending 24 hours in a cell to raise funds for a mental health charity after recovering from an attack which left him suffering post-traumatic stress disorder .
greater manchester police constable adnan ali , who is based in trafford , developedthe condition after attending a dispute between neighbours in 2013 .
he was stabbed three times in the head , as well as being slashed in the face and neck .
now pc ali is raising the funds for the moodswings charity .
the occupational health and welfare unit at greater manchester police were a great support , especially in providing access to a psychologist .
after my treatment finished i knew that i needed extra help .
it was then that a friend recommended moodswings

documents.title: fraudster stole woman 's £ 160k savings
text: fraudster stole woman 's £ 160k savings

documents.title: football : afc fylde sign former salford city defender
text: afc fylde have signed former salford city central defender simon grand ahead of their debut national league season .

the 33-year-old began his career with rochdale , moved to carlisle in summer 2004 and also had spells with northwich , fleetwood , southport and barrow , where he won promotion to the national league in 2015 .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: latest headlines from the north west
text: latest headlines from the north west

documents.title: charlene downes : fourteen-year search for missing teenager
text: a 51-year-old man has been arrested on sus of the murder of blackpool teenager charlene downes who has been missing for nearly 14 years .
it is a significant development in a case that has often appeared to have left police baffled .
the teenager was 14 when she disappeared on 1 november 2003 .
her body has never been found .
in 2008 , a judge cleared a man of the girl 's murder after `` grave doubts '' were raised about evidence during a second trial .
the jury in his first trial failed to reach a verdict .
a year later the independent police complaints commission said police evidence-gathering errors had contributed to the retrial 's collapse .
last year , cctv footage was released that showed charlene with her sister rebecca in bank hey street in blackpool .
she returned to the town centre later that evening , and it was the last time she was seen .
her mother karen said she was `` disgusted '' the footage had only just been found after years spent investigating the unsolved murder case .
author: Jon Lowe
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: football : liverpool boss 'wo n't sign more midfielders '
text: liverpool manager jurgen klopp will not sign another midfielder this summer despite missing out on rb leipzig 's 22-year-old naby keita , says former defender jamie carragher .
read more in the bbc sport gossip column

documents.title: 'whistleblowing ' gp loses legal fight after mod sacking
text: a doctor who claimed he was sacked by the ministry of defence for whistleblowing has lost his legal battle .
dr stephen frost was working at weeton army barracks , near blackpool , when he was dismissed in september 2013 .
the 70-year-old , of colwyn bay , raised concerns an army veteran may have been given the wrong dose of morphine .
the mod had said he was dismissed for failing to tell the patient about the error .

documents.title: weather : warm with sunny spells
text: showers will begin to ease this afternoon to leave some pleasantly warm sunshine with fairly light winds .
highs of 18c .
more from bbc weather .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: investigation into pc death during training exercise
text: a new investigation into the death of a greater manchester police officer during a firearms training exercise has been launched by the police watchdog .
pc ian terry , 32 , was killed in june 2008 during training at a disused warehouse in east manchester .
the investigation by the independent police complaints commission is looking at fresh allegations into the evidence provided by officers after the shooting .
no officers have ever faced criminal charges over the death but an inquest in 2010 found he was unlawfully killed .

documents.title: navas rejoins sevilla on four-year deal
text: navas rejoins sevilla on four-year deal

documents.title: quacking job ! rspca rescue ducklings from drain
text: six ducklings were rescued after they fell down a drain in warrington - with the help of a recording of their mother 's calls .
rspca animal welfare officer katie glenn played the recording on her phone to help coax the ducklings from the drain under rosemoor gardens .
the six young birds were brought out by a net , although a further two had already died .
i think those poor little ducklings had been down there alone since the night before .
the distress of the mother duck was heart-rending .

documents.title: latest headlines for the north west
text: latest headlines for the north west

documents.title: attempted murder arrest after lancashire house blaze
text: a man has been arrested on sus of attempted murder after a woman was found with stab wounds following a house fire .
the 39-year-old man was held after he was rescued from a blaze in loveclough , along with a woman , 25 , and a one-year-old girl .
the woman was later found to have suffered stab wound , police said .
author: Lancashire Telegraph

documents.title: manchester firearms police : a unit in turmoil ?
text: greater manchester police is facing new investigations by the police watchdog over three separate fatal firearms incidents , the victoria derbyshire programme has learned .
it raises questions about the conduct of one of the uk 's second biggest firearms units at a time when manchester has recently been hit by a terror attack .
a public inquiry into one of the deaths has heard about flawed intelligence , a senior officer destroying notes and employment of an officer disciplined for assault .
its former head of training , john foxcroft , said he left the firearms unit due to its `` aggressive '' tactics .
author: Victoria Derbyshire

documents.title: pedestrian hit by van remains critical
text: a man remains in a critical condition in hospital after he was hit by a truck in wigan at the weekend .
the 43-year-old was hit by the vehicle on darley road in hawkley about 20:30 on saturday .
the driver of the truck was uninjured .
anyone with any information , paerticularly dash-cam footage , is asked to contact police .

documents.title: charlene downes : £ 100k reward remains on offer for information
text: fourteen-year-old charlene downes disappeared on 1 november 2003 .
her body has never been found .
police said the 51-year-old man arrested on sus of her murder lived in blackpool at the time of her disappearance , and remains in custody .
a £ 100,000 reward remains on offer for information leading to the conviction of her killer or killers .
in july , charlene 's mother said she was going to sue police over alleged mishandling of the murder case .
karen downes said she would take legal action over a 13-year gap in releasing cctv images of the teenager 's last day alive .

documents.title: latest headlines from the north west
text: latest headlines from the north west

documents.title: breakingmurder arrest over 2003 disappearance of blackpool teenager
text: a man has been arrested on sus of the murder of blackpool teenager charlene downes , who was last seen in 2003 .
the 51-year-old suspect , who lived in blackpool at the time of charlene 's disappearance , remains in custody , lancashire police said .
the girl was 14 at the time of her disappearance .

documents.title: family 's tribute to 'beautiful soul ' who died after cigarette punch
text: a man who was punched and later died after he was stopped and asked for a cigarette was a `` beautiful soul '' who `` dedicated his life to charity '' , his family have said .
len saunders , 65 , from st helens , was with a friend when they were asked whether they had a cigarette in ward street , st helens , on 21 july .
after replying that they did not smoke , mr saunders was punched in the head and fell to the ground , police said .
he was taken to hospital and died on sunday .
two boys aged 15 and 17 have been arrested on sus of murder .
mr saunders ' family said in a statement : `` he was a talented actor , poet and musician who never stopped helping people , even in his final moments .
`` born in st helens , he was deeply rooted within the community in various projects and is sorely missed by all whose lives he touched . ''

documents.title: ambulance crew suspended over 'gross failures ' in treating ill woman
text: three ambulance crew members have been suspended after an inquest heard there were delays and `` gross failure '' to provide care to a woman who died from an adverse reaction to paracetamol .
beatrice lovane , 22 , from rochdale , fell ill before 21:30 on 26 august .
returning a narrative verdict heywood coroner lisa hashmi said she died of liver disease and damage caused by painkillers .
north west ambulance service admitted errors and is staging another inquiry .

documents.title: latest headlines for the north west
text: latest headlines for the north west

documents.title: football : man utd defender banned for abusing a uefa offical
text: manchester united defender phil jones has been suspended for two matches for verbally abusing a uefa anti-doping officer at the europa league final .
jones was found guilty of `` directing insulting and directing abusive language '' and `` a lack of cooperation and respect '' towards the official .
united were also fined £ 8,900 , while jones was fined £ 4,450 .
his team-mate daley blind was also charged with an anti-doping rules violation , but was only fined £ 4,450 .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: weather : mixture of sunshine and showers
text: it will be another day of sunshine and showers , some of them heavy and thundery .
showers will tend to ease through the afternoon giving some pleasantly warm sunshine with fairly light winds .
highs today of 18c .
more from bbc weather .

documents.title: weather : showers and sunshine all week
text: showers should continue overnight but clearer skies will develop , allowing it to turn chilly by dawn .
tuesday will bring another day of sunshine and showers , with the rain becoming heavy in places with a risk of hail and thunder .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: firm behind chinatown scheme 'to close '
text: firm behind chinatown scheme 'to close '

documents.title: drugs arrest after teenagers admitted to hospital
text: a man has been arrested on sus of drug dealing after three children were hospitalised after taking drugs in manchester .
two girls aged 13 and 14 , and a 15-year-old boy , fell ill between december 2016 and july in the south of the city .
each case involved reports of children being approached by a man with class a , b and c drugs .
a 19-year-old man was arrested and has been released pending further inquiries .
greater manchester police said ecstasy , cannabis , cocaine and benzodiazepines as well as several phones and cash had been recovered in northenden .
the children have all made full recoveries , a statement from the force added .

documents.title: sexist comment £ 360k payout upheld
text: a former secretary at bae systems who was told by her line manager `` women take things more emotionally than men '' has had her £ 360,000 payout upheld .
marion konczak , 62 , suffered a mental breakdown and went off sick with stress after the comment was made and she was dismissed in july 2007 .
she had been working on a big project for the royal saudi air force in samlesbury when she complained that she had been `` bullied and harassed , including sexually '' .
bae systems attacked the payout as `` grossly excessive '' for `` a single sexist comment '' following an employment tribunal that ruled she was unfairly dismissed .
three judges at the court of appeal in london backed mrs konczak and rejected bae 's complaints .
bae systems has been contacted for a comment .

documents.title: latest headlines for the north west
text: latest headlines for the north west

documents.title: manchester airport police 'thought pipe bomb was not viable '
text: a man accused of trying to smuggle a pipe bomb on to a plane flew again days later as police did not think the device was viable , a court has heard .
nadeem muhammad , 43 , denies possession of explosives with intent to endanger life or property .
security officers found a device made from batteries , tape , a marker pen , pins and a smokeless propellant at manchester airport on 30 january .
there was no trace of explosive when it was swabbed , the court heard .

documents.title: vc medals of passchendaele battle soldier go on display
text: the medals of one of britain 's most decorated soldiers have gone on display at the museum of liverpool .

capt noel chavasse was awarded the victoria cross ( vc ) , the highest military medal , twice during world war one ( ww1 ) with his second being given posthumously , after his bravery in the battle of passchendaele a century ago .
the liverpool surgeon and army officer won his first vc in 1916 when he had tended to the wounded while under heavy fire and a second , a year later .
he was given the award because he did not stop any of his medical duties despite being injured .
capt chavasse died on 4 august 1917 , at the age of 32 , and is buried at brandhoek new military cemetery in belgium .
the exhibition marks the first time capt chavasse 's medals have been on display in liverpool , which was his family 's hometown since 1900 .
services are being held to mark 100 years since the battle of passchendaele , which was one of the bloodiest battles of ww1 .

documents.title: man admits tudor mansion arson attack
text: a man has admitted setting fire to a 16th century tudor mansion in greater manchester .
at its height , 50 firefighters tackled the blaze at wythenshawe hall , which is owned by manchester city council , on 15 march 2016 .
jeremy taylor , 28 , of cheadle hulme pleaded guilty to arson at manchester crown court .
he was remanded in custody for sentencing on 18 august .
the roof and upper floor of the grade ii timber-framed hall , which was built in 1540 , were gutted in the fire .

documents.title: liverpool supporters vote in favour in fans ' group online poll
text: liverpool supporters have voted in favour of safe standing , in an online poll run by a leading fans ' group .
spirit of shankly had an `` emotive and sensitive '' debate on the issue before holding an open vote , and 88 % of the 17,910 people who voted were in favour .
there were 5 % against , while the rest were undecided or wanted to know more .
liverpool have said their supporters ' position on safe standing is `` uniquely complex '' because 96 fans died during the hillsborough disaster in 1989 .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: motorcyclist dies after lamppost crash
text: a motorcyclist has died in hospital after hitting a lamppost .
marcin jurek was travelling on the north valley road in colne at about 05:25 on saturday when he lost control .
he was taken to hospital where he later died .
no-one else was injured .
the 39-year-old , who lived in nelson , was a polish national .
police said are appealing for anyone with information to contact them .

documents.title: latest headlines for the north west
text: latest headlines for the north west

documents.title: people 'struggling to cope ' after manchester attack offered help
text: a dedicated mental health service to help people still affected by the manchester arena attack has been launched .
twenty-two people - including six children - were killed when salman abedi detonated a suicide bomb at an ariana grande concert on 22 may .
the manchester resilience hub , run by the nhs , will focus on helping those directly affected including young people and emergency responders .
clinical lead , dr alan barrett , said those who were `` closest to the incident , witnessed the aftermath or were involved in the immediate care of victims '' were likely to be most in need :
the attack will have affected lots of people in some way or another but most will find they recover naturally and do n't require any professional support .
if by now people are still struggling to cope , they may benefit from some professional mental health support .

documents.title: weather : risk of hail and thunder
text: it will be another day of sunshine and showers , with a risk of hail and thunder .
highs of 20c .
more from bbc weather
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: man dies after punch over cigarette plea
text: a 65-year-old man has died after being punched in the head when he told a man wanting a cigarette that he did not smoke .

len saunders was walking with a friend when they were approached by two men who asked whether they smoked and if they could borrow a cigarette in ward street , st helens , just before 19:00 on friday .
when the pair said they did not smoke , mr saunders was punched by one of the men and fell to the floor .
mr saunders was taken to hospital for treatment and died yesterday .
a post-mortem examination is taking place to establish the cause of his death .
police are appealing for any witnesses to contact them .

documents.title: death crash victim had planned germany move
text: a `` loving '' father who died after a car crash was about to start a new life in germany with his pregnant partner and two daughters , his family have said .
michal kayser was seriously hurt when the nissan almera he was driving hit a wall on blackburn road in haslingden , lancashire , on the morning of 23 july .
the 33-year-old , who lived in the town , died in hospital six days later .
his family said it was a `` true tragedy '' as he had been out celebrating his birthday and saying goodbye to friends .

documents.title: passchendaele commemorations take place across the region
text: a series of events to mark the 100th anniversary of the battle of passchendaele are getting under way in belgium and across the north west .
half a million allied and german soldiers were killed , wounded or went missing in three months of fighting .
one of those to die on the very first day was the poet hedd wyn .
ellis humphrey evans - hedd wyn - had fallen on the first day of the third battle of ypres , better known as passchendaele .
he was sent to the litherland camp near liverpool for training .
coincidentally , it is claimed , at the same time as another world war one great poet : siegfried sassoon .
his nephew said the poet overstayed his leave in june , and was arrested for being absent without leave , before being shipped out to france with 15th royal welsh fusiliers .
he joined his battalion at nord-pas-de-calais at the beginning of july , where he finished and posted his poetic masterpiece , yr arwr - the hero , to the eisteddfod .
just two weeks later , at dawn on 31 july , he went over the top .

documents.title: young mum suffering fatal reaction to painkillers was accused of 'faking it ' by paramedics
text: beatrice lovane was told by paramedics to 'behave ' , 'stop humiliating ' herself , and was refused a wheelchair as she lay dying in a stairwell .
author: Manchester Evening News

documents.title: appeal for missing teenager
text: police are appealing for information about a 14-year-old boy who has been missing for five weeks .
daniel smith , from preston , was last seen around edmund street in the city on 24 may .
he is described as white , about 5ft 3in tall and of slim build .
he has short light brown hair and speaks with a regional accent .
a police spokesman said : `` daniel has been missing for some time now and it is clearly very concerning . ''
anyone with information is asked to contact police .

documents.title: the refugee doctor who is giving back
text: a doctor who came to britain as a teenage asylum seeker from afghanistan is helping to save lives abroad using digital technology .
dr waheed arian , from chester , is on a career break from aintree hospital and has been using smart phones and social media to advise doctors in war zones or remote areas .

documents.title: firefighters tackle oldham waste fire
text: firefighters are still at the scene of a fire that broke out yesterday evening at an industrial estate in oldham .
greater manchester fire and rescue service were called to mossdown road in the heyside area at about 19:15 last night .
they found a large pile of waste on fire which then spread to a nearby building .
nearby residents have been advised to keep their doors and windows closed .
update - we still have three fire engines and an aerial appliance at the industrial estate fire in oldham
keep safe !
x

documents.title: triathlon races through salford quays
text: triathletes returned to salford quays to compete over the weekend .
the swim took place at dock 9 , with participants wearing wetsuits in the 18c heat .

after the swim athletes took to their bikes to complete the next part of the course around mediacityuk and across trafford park , taking in views such as the set of coronation street , the imperial war museum north and manchester united 's old trafford stadium .
bikes were then left aside so entrants could complete the run , which took in views across the lowry footbridge and views across the quays before participants embarked on the sprint finish .
chuffed with a finish time of 2:58:16 on the olympic tri today big up to the marshals on the run , they were fab ! !
@ twitterid
the clouds threatened to spoil the day @ twitterid but alas we all had a fantastic day well done to all the @ twitterid # manchester
amazing day out watching my pals doing the @ twitterid
great photo !

documents.title: manchester attack review will 'give voice ' to victims
text: the review into the response to the manchester attack will `` give voice '' to the victims families , its chair lord kerslake has said .
twenty-two people were killed when salman abedi detonated a suicide bomb after an ariana grande concert on 22 may .
lord kerslake , the ex-head of the civil service , said those affected would have insights `` that wo n't necessarily be available to the emergency services '' .
an interim report should be complete by christmas , he added .

documents.title: weather : a day of sunshine and showers
text: it will be another day of sunshine and showers , these heaviest inland with a risk of hail and thunder .
around the coasts it will be drier , but breezy , although on the whole winds will be lighter yesterday .
highs of 19c .
more from bbc weather .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage
text: welcome to a new week and to north west live .
we 're here until 18:00 with all the latest news , sport , travel and weather from across the region .
